source_caption_data.pre_caption: This is a scenery shot of the Elizabeth Tower (Big Ben) and the Houses of Parliament in London. The camera is in motion, moving past the iconic landmarks, likely from a vehicle on a bridge. The clouds also appear to be moving quickly in a time-lapse effect across the dramatic, teal-colored sky.
source_caption_data.pre_caption_prompt: The video is a scenery shot. You do not need to describe the subject motion. Just note that briefly in one to three sentences.
source_caption_data.final_caption: This is a scenery shot of the Elizabeth Tower (Big Ben) and the Houses of Parliament in London. The camera is in motion, moving past the iconic landmarks, likely from a vehicle on a bridge. The clouds also appear to be moving quickly in a time-lapse effect across the dramatic, teal-colored sky.

generated_critique: The caption incorrectly includes speculative language ("likely," "appear to be") and subjective adjectives ("iconic," "dramatic"), which are forbidden by the instructions. It also omits the motion of the two red double-decker buses visible on the right side of the frame. The introductory sentence identifying the location is redundant as it repeats information from the subject description and detracts from the primary focus on motion. The description should be revised to state the observable movements directly and objectively, incorporating the motion of the camera, the time-lapsed clouds, and the buses.
revised_caption_by_generated_critique: The camera moves past the Elizabeth Tower (Big Ben) and the Houses of Parliament. Clouds move quickly across the teal-colored sky in a time-lapse effect, while on the right, two red double-decker buses travel along the road.
